channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: US officially withdrawing from World Health Organization
item.description: The Trump administration has notified Congress and the United Nations that the United States is formally withdrawing from the World Health Organization, multiple officials tell CNN, a move that comes amid a rising number of coronavirus cases throughout the Americas in the last week alone.

item.title: What we learned from Mary Trump's damning tell-all about Donald Trump
See Florida governor's response to critical virus question
item.description: In a press conference, Florida Gov. Ron Desantis and Miami-Dade County mayor Carlos GimÃ©nez were pushed by a reporter on contract tracers after there was confusion over whether the governor or mayor could hire contact tracers during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Trump rebukes Fauci: 'I think we're in a good place'
Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro tests positive for coronavirus
US outbreak is so bad that contact tracing is no longer possible across the South, expert says
Covid-19 closed this border for the first time in 100 years
item.description: Australia has closed the border between the states of Victoria and New South Wales in a bid to control a coronavirus outbreak in Victoria. Strict lockdown measures will also be reimposed in Australia's second largest city and Victoria's capital, Melbourne.

item.title: I got Covid-19 two months ago. I'm still discovering new areas of damage
item.description: The cough has come back, without warning and seemingly for no reason; so has the fatigue. True, neither are as debilitating as when I had the actual virus, but they are back.

item.title: Over 1 million international students in the US may be forced to leave. Here's where they're from
One area of the US may seal Trump's 2020 fate
item.description: The path to the White House for Republican presidential candidates almost always goes through the suburbs.

item.title: America's passport is now as weak as Mexico's
item.description: Before Covid-19 struck, the world was enjoying greater freedom of movement than at any time in history.

item.title: US Sen. who lost her legs serving in Iraq slams Tucker Carlson for saying she hates America
item.description: Democratic Sen. Tammy Duckworth, a US Army veteran who lost both of her legs while serving in Iraq, rebuked Tucker Carlson after the conservative Fox News host attacked her on Monday night and suggested that she hates America.

item.title: FBI director unleashes on China in speech
item.description: Chinese hackers have moved swiftly to target US pharmaceutical and research institutions making progress in the fight against coronavirus, FBI Director Christopher Wray said Tuesday in a wide-ranging speech that included some of the agency's starkest accusations about the country's threat to the US to date.

item.title: Secret torture site discovered in shipping containers
item.description: Authorities in the Netherlands have discovered an apparent torture site hidden inside shipping containers, which were lined with sound-proofing material and filled with assumed torture devices, the country's National Prosecutor's Office has said.

item.title: Anderson Cooper: Trump wants you to suck it up as thousands die
item.description: CNN's Anderson Cooper slams President Donald Trump's comment that coronavirus is "99% harmless" while the number of cases in the US continue to rise.

item.title: Deutsche Bank fined $150M for failing to flag Epstein's shady transactions
item.description: New York regulators fined Deutsche Bank $150 million Tuesday and slammed the lender for "mistakes and sloppiness" in its relationship with accused sex-trafficker Jeffrey Epstein.

item.title: Man fights off one of the world's deadliest snakes while driving on highway
item.description: When a traffic officer pulled over a pickup truck on an Australian highway, he didn't expect to find one of the world's deadliest snakes inside.

item.title: East Wing braces for upcoming book by former Melania Trump aide
item.description: The East Wing is bracing for the upcoming book by Stephanie Winston Wolkoff, titled, "Melania and Me," a source familiar with the situation tells CNN.

item.title: Top Obama strategist explains why Trump's tactics aren't working
item.description: White House press secretary Kayleigh McEnany refused to denounce the Confederate flag during a press briefing after President Donald Trump bemoaned NASCAR's recent decision to ban it from all races and events. CNN's David Axelrod analyzes Trump's strategy of stoking racial divide in the nation to gain re-election.

item.title: Facebook ad boycott organizers met with Zuckerberg. It didn't go well
item.description: Civil rights and activist groups blasted Facebook's leadership on Tuesday after meeting with CEO Mark Zuckerberg and other executives to discuss the demands of a large advertiser boycott that now includes hundreds of brands.

item.title: US is considering a ban on TikTok and other Chinese social media apps, Pompeo says
Trump's risky nose-to-nose challenge to China in the South China Sea
item.description: Donald Trump managed to avoid touching off a forest fire in the tinder-dry forest around Mount Rushmore with his Independence Day fireworks display, but instead his administration seems to be doing its best to set Asia on fire in the South China Sea.

item.title: Jimmy John's employees fired for noose video
item.description: A Jimmy John's sandwich restaurant in Woodstock, Georgia, has fired multiple employees after a video showed them joking around with a noose made from pizza dough.

item.title: Comedian Rickey Smiley's 19-year-old daughter shot multiple times
item.description: The 19-year-old daughter of comedian and syndicated radio host Rickey Smiley is currently recovering after being shot during an alleged road rage incident.

item.title: Australia's second-largest city to be locked down for six weeks to curb second wave
item.description: Strict lockdown measures are to be reimposed in Australia's second largest city, as authorities scramble to prevent a second wave of coronavirus infections spreading across the country.

item.title: Citizens collectively ring pots when this world leader goes on TV
item.description: In the age of Covid-19, President Donald Trump and Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro are two of a kind. CNN's Bill Weir reports on how the US and Brazil lead the world in the number of cases while their leaders downplay coronavirus.

item.title: Tom Hanks gives first TV interview since Covid-19 recovery
item.description: Having experienced the devastating effects of Covid-19 firsthand, Tom Hanks is urging people to do their part in preventing the virus from spreading even further.

item.title: Florida jogger finds decomposing human head on side of the road
item.description: A woman out for a run in St. Petersburg, Florida, came across a decomposing human head on the side of the road on Tuesday, according to police.

item.title: Newly appointed French minister faces rape allegations
item.description: France's newly appointed interior minister Gerald Darmanin could face a fresh investigation into an alleged rape following a court ruling, sources close to the case told CNN on Tuesday.

item.title: Masks are effective only if you wear them properly. Here's the right (and wrong) way
item.description: So, about masks -- they do next to nothing if you don't wear them properly.

item.title: Bubonic plague outbreak prompts crack down on marmot hunting
item.description: Russian authorities have warned people near the country's border with Mongolia not to hunt or eat marmots after an outbreak of bubonic plague.

item.title: Former Kasabian frontman pleads guilty to assaulting ex-fiancee
item.description: The former frontman of British rock band Kasabian has pleaded guilty to assaulting his ex-fiancee -- a day after it was announced he was quitting the band over "personal issues."

item.title: China investing billions in chipmaking to close the gap with global rivals
item.description: China's largest semiconductor maker could raise as much as $7.5 billion this year by listing its stock in Shanghai â a move that could deliver the Chinese mainland its largest share sale in a decade, and reduce the country's reliance on foreign chips.

item.title: How airplanes fill up with fuel mid-air
item.description: Imagine you're zooming down the highway at 70 miles per hour and the car's fuel gauge is on its way to empty.

item.title: Luxury train hotel permanently stuck on a bridge
item.description: Though luxury hotel openings have slowed to a trickle this year due to the Covid-19 pandemic, there are still a few exciting new properties opening their doors to guests in 2020.

item.title: Pink snow causing accelerated melting
item.description: Scientists are studying the climate impact of the spread of algae that is turning snow pink in the Italian Alps.

item.title: Covid-19 kept them from their pets for months. So they've chartered a plane to bring them home
item.description: In May, Kyla Robertson was trying to find a way to bring Sugar home.

item.title: White parents: Talk to your kids about racism to raise more empathic adults
item.description: Though race and racism are at the top of Americans' public discussion, most white parents don't talk about those issues with their kids.

item.title: Lin-Manuel Miranda responds to 'Hamilton' slavery criticism
item.description: Disney+ has scored a hit with the filmed version of "Hamilton," but that success has renewed discussion about how the musical deals with the slaveholders it portrays.

item.title: Halle Berry apologizes and is no longer considering a transgender role in upcoming film
item.description: After facing backlash on social media, actress Halle Berry announced on Twitter Monday she is no longer considering portraying a transgender man in an upcoming film role.

item.title: How one diver became the 'shark whisperer'
item.description: Cristina Zenato needs only two words to describe sharksânature's masterpiece. A professional diver in the Bahamas, she loves sharks. Especially the Caribbean reef sharks that flourish around Grand Bahama Island, thanks in large part to her efforts to protect them. The sharks swim right up to the woman known as the "shark whisperer" and nuzzle against her while she pets them like they're dogs or cats. Great Big Story takes a dive off Grand Bahama Island with Zenato to learn how she built such a strong bond with these beautiful creatures.

item.title: Can the AC filter in your home, office or local mall protect you from Covid-19?
item.description: When New York Governor Andrew Cuomo announced last week that malls in New York could not reopen until they installed high-efficiency particulate air filters capable of trapping the virus that causes Covid-19, Harvard environmental health researcher Joseph Gardner Allen was thrilled.

item.title: Tottenham boss praises 'beautiful' spat between two of his players
item.description: Tottenham manager Jose Mourinho says the clash between his captain Hugo Lloris and forward Son Heung-min was "beautiful," as his side beat Everton 1-0 in the Premier League on Monday.

item.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro tests positive for Covid-19
item.description: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro has tested positive for Covid-19, Bolsonaro himself announced, speaking on Brazilian TV channels Tuesday.

item.title: Trump and Fauci clash over coronavirus outlook
item.description: Dr. Anthony Fauci warned Tuesday that Americans shouldn't take comfort in the dropping death rate among coronavirus patients in the US even as President Donald Trump touts the trend as evidence of a successful response to the virus.

item.title: The ugly truth about millions of US jobs
item.description: The American economy's unprecedented jobs rebound masks a difficult truth: For millions of people, the jobs they lost are never coming back.

item.title: What we learned from Mary Trump's damning tell-all about Donald Trump
item.description: â¢ Book: Trump paid someone to take his SATs â¢ Mary Trump reveals she was NYT source

item.title: Over 1 million international students in the US may be forced to leave. Here's where they're from
What Jefferson's descendants think of his statues
item.description: CNN's Poppy Harlow talks with Lucian Truscott and Shannon LaNier, descendants of Thomas Jefferson, about what they think of Jefferson's memorial in Washington as calls grow for the removal of monuments and statues of slave owners across the nation.
